instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332A: What is 820-3332A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG? PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG is a power rail that powers the GPU in an S0 working state. .

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Fan spins continuously on battery but no chime and no display. No fan spin without battery, Yellow light on Magsafe Adapter. Checked all voltage rails and results as below.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_CONN</SIGNAL> = 16.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.1 v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = Missing.

What next?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
This board will not start without 85W charger, if battery not present.
Board turns on with both charger and battery connected?
Do you get USB activity?

Start resoldering <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded solder.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Yes. board turns on with both charger and battery connected and after connecting to 85w charger, turns on without battery. USB activity - just the red light on. no blinking. Fan spins but no display.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: And i even get 3.3v on  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Do you get voltages on CPU and GPU coils?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
You should get voltage on L8930/60.
L7550/60 only get voltage under heavy graphics load, when Intel graphics is used.

Check GPU Rail Sequencing, page 88.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Checked rails and result... I hope i am doing it right. All rails showing 3.3v doesn't seem right.... 
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9121</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 3,3v
<SIGNAL>P1V8GPU_EN</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9122</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9123</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 3.3v
P1V35GPUFB_EN - <RESISTOR>R9124</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P1V05_S0GPU_EN</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9125</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 3.3v

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
You measured enable signals.
Check if each power supply which receive the enable, generates output voltage...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: please... can u explain once how i do it. Just an example with 1 rail.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> controls <SIGNAL>3V3_GPU</SIGNAL> and so on.
Follow each enable signal and see if corresponding power supply (just a MOSFET in some case), generates the output voltage.
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  --> <TRANSISTOR>Q7872</TRANSISTOR> --> <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> --> <SIGNAL>3V3_GPU</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Just a quick observation. I was checking GPU voltages and found <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> - 900mv on Pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C8961</CAPACITOR>/63. I was wondering if this is the cause of the problem. Should I change <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and check? Just a thought before I post the voltages you asked for later today.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: 0.9V looks good for GPU VCORE.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Findings as requested. Hope i am on the right track...


<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> ‚Äì <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> Pin 2 ‚Äì 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN_L</SIGNAL> ‚Äì <TRANSISTOR>Q7872</TRANSISTOR> Pin 3 ‚Äì 300mv
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_PGOOD</SIGNAL> ‚Äì <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> Pin 1 ‚Äì 3.1v
<SIGNAL>GPUFB_PGOOD</SIGNAL> - <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> Pin 14 ‚Äì 1.7v
<SIGNAL>P1V05_S0GPU_PGOOD</SIGNAL> ‚Äì <CHIP>U8310</CHIP> Pin 9 ‚Äì 1.8v

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Seems that you didn't understand me.
I said
"<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>  --> <TRANSISTOR>Q7872</TRANSISTOR> --> <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> --> <SIGNAL>3V3_GPU</SIGNAL>"
in other words, if <SIGNAL>3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> is present, then <SIGNAL>3V3_GPU</SIGNAL> must be present too.
I was expecting that you apply the same rule for the other GPU rails...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Sorry.. I simply can‚Äôt get the hang of this one. Any links where I can read up on this. I feel I should give up on this board.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Search in pdf for each signal name and found corresponding power supplies.

Check voltage at L8360, L8310, L8930/60 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> output.

L8930 ‚Äì 900 mv
L8960 ‚Äì 905 mv
<TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR> output. ‚Äì 3.3v

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:

Then what was this???
"L8960 - L8930 - No voltage"
When do we expect to have correct information reported?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: I am sorry but this is what it is. Just 900mv on both the coils.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
"Just 900mv on both the coils".
And is the exact voltage must be there.

Post exact voltage at L7510/20/30 in the first moment and after 10-15 seconds.
One coil is sufficient to measure.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: 1.118v on L7510 right from the moment it starts and steady after 20 seconds...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
So board doesn't really boot.
VCORE should drop to 0.78V aprox, when does.

Try known good RAM module, each slot separately.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Am I missing something here.... aren't the ram modules soldered on board. how do I change the ram modules.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Right, I was thinking about 3330 board, sorry.

You can try to disable GPU, just in case.
The necessary information is already posted on the forum.
